Package org.mitre.synthea.helpers

Class Attributes

java.lang.Object
org.mitre.synthea.helpers.Attributes
public class Attributes
extends java.lang.Object
Task class to export a report of all Person attributes that Synthea is aware of. Does not include Clinician or Provider specific attributes.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes

    class  Attributes.Inventory

    Inventory an attribute with read, write, and example values.
    static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)

  • Constructor Details

    • Attributes

      public Attributes()

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args) throws java.lang.Exception
      Generate an output file containing all Person attributes used in Synthea. Attributes of Clinicians and Providers are not included.
      Parameters:
      args - unused
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - if any error occurs in reading the module files

    • getAttributeInventory

      public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​Attributes.Inventory> getAttributeInventory() throws java.lang.Exception
      Get the list of all Person attributes in Synthea, as a list of CSV strings.
      Returns:
      list of CSV strings
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - if any exception occurs in reading the modules.

    • inventory

      public static void inventory​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​Attributes.Inventory> attributes, java.lang.String module, java.lang.String attribute, boolean read, boolean write, java.lang.String example)
      Inventory an attribute with read, write, and example values.
      Parameters:
      attributes - The inventory.
      module - The module name.
      attribute - The attribute name.
      read - Whether the module reads the attribute or not.
      write - Whether the module writes to the attribute or not.
      example - Example values the module writes.

    • graph

      public static void graph​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​Attributes.Inventory> output, java.lang.String filename, boolean readAndWrite)
      Output a graphviz image of the inventoried attributes.
      Parameters:
      output - The results of getAttributeInventory()
      filename - The filename of the image (without a path or extension) to write.
      readAndWrite - If false, all nodes are rendered. If true, only attributes that are both read from and written to are considered.
